plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular autumn-flowering plant known for its diverse and vibrant flower forms and colors. Chrysanthemums are cultivated worldwide and often signify the arrival of fall in temperate regions.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially in North America, Europe, and East Asia
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are considered the flower of autumn in Japan and are celebrated during the annual Festival of Happiness.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A striking, medium-sized tree famous for its bright red, spiky flowers that bloom in late spring to autumn, favored in subtropical climates of South America.
plants.bloomingSeason: September to November (Southern Hemisphere spring to autumn)
plants.funFact: Erythrina crista-galli is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Rhododendron autumnale
plants.description: A deciduous azalea species that blooms in autumn with pink to white flowers, thriving in temperate forests mainly in eastern North America.
plants.funFact: Unlike many azaleas that bloom in spring, this species uniquely flowers in the fall, adding color late in the year.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree with golden cylindrical flower spikes that appear in late spring through autumn, important as a nectar source for birds and mammals.
plants.funFact: Coast Banksia's flower spikes are rich in nectar and are a vital resource for honeyeaters and other pollinators during the cooler months.
